item.title: Scottish venues told to 'use common sense' on vaccine passports
item.description: The Scottish government sets out details of which venues and events will need to check vaccine passports.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Soldiers to drive ambulances from this weekend
item.description: The MoD says it will provide a total of 225 personnel to drive ambulances and help run mobile testing units.

item.title: Swimmers dodge jellyfish on four islands challenge
item.description: The "Salty Kelpies" swam for more than six miles from the Bass Rock to Craigleith, Lamb and Fidra in the Firth of Forth.

item.title: Wigtown Book Festival gets 'show back on the road'
item.description: Scotland's national book town begins another "unique" event after being entirely online in 2020.

item.title: Scotland women 7-1 Faroe Islands women - Martinez Losa's side cruise to victory
item.description: Scotland cruise to victory against the Faroe Islands in their first ever qualifier at Hampden Park to maintain a perfect start to their World Cup bid.

item.title: Margaret McCarron named as woman who died after being hit by police van
item.description: Margaret McCarron, 58, was walking on a street in Motherwell when she was hit by the marked van.

item.title: Grateful ex-student donates £50m to Strathclyde University
item.description: Businessman Charles Huang's funding gift to Strathclyde University is the largest in its 200-year history.

item.title: Hospitals inquiry: Boy's deadly infection 'came from hospital drains'
item.description: A mother tells an inquiry her 10-year-old son almost died from an infection caught while going through cancer treatment.

item.title: Orange walks: Fourteen arrested over 'disorder' in Glasgow
item.description: Police said most offences were for public disorder but also included sectarian-related breach of the peace.

item.title: Pedestrian injured during Aberdeen police pursuit dies
item.description: A 28-year-old man has been arrested and is due in court after the 48-year-old man died in Aberdeen.

item.title: Drink driver sentenced over death of friends in Fife crash
item.description: Connor Aird and Ethan King, both 17, died as a result of the collision in Fife caused by Logan Russell.

item.title: Firefighters tackle blaze in Taynuilt Inn in Argyll

item.title: Edinburgh's Christmas to be spread across the city
item.description: The festive event is to expand to a site beneath Edinburgh Castle in West Princes Street Gardens.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What do we know about the vaccine passport?
item.description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has given more details about how Scotland's scheme will operate.

item.title: Vaccine passports: The key questions on the scheme's introduction to Scottish sport
item.description: BBC Scotland examines the key questions surrounding the impact of vaccine passports in Scottish sport.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Crash cyclist Josh Quigley sets new Guinness World Record

item.description: Brian Keeley shares his experience of a heart transplant six months after a new organ donor system was introduced.

item.title: Theatre finds ways to mark the grief of the Covid pandemic

item.title: Covid in Scotland: First vaccinated care home resident receives booster dose

item.title: Ian Blackford challenges Johnson on inflation rate

item.title: From council house to royal palace: My life as the Queen’s piper

item.title: Vaccine passport plans 'warmly welcomed' by SFA & SPFL

item.title: Moselle Open: Andy Murray beats Ugo Humbert to reach second round

item.title: Scotland 7-1 Faroe Islands: 'So much more we can improve on,' says Christy Grimshaw

item.title: Celtic make pre-tax loss of £11.5m in annual accounts
item.description: Celtic lost £11.5m last year after a fall in revenue of almost £10m, the club reveal in their annual results.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: Andy Murray won't 'wade in' with advice and opinion
item.description: Andy Murray says he would "always be on the end of the phone" to give Emma Raducanu help - but only if she asks for it.
